poem:
"Green Revolution in Southern Stars"

Torchbearer of promise in twilight's hue,
From decadent decade's ashes, steps Milei, true.
Buenos Aires, where light and shadow duel,
Under turquoise dome, where the golden rules rule.
Yet, morning star whispers a fiscal mewl,
Inauguration's dawn, mirrors a splendid fool.
Argentina, sing before the tide's cruel,
Fair liberty's torch, to it be loyal.
prompt: You are the poet Dylan Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling sentimental. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Javier Milei sworn in as president in ‘tipping point’ for Argentina Argentina’s new president, Javier Milei, has vowed to lead his country out of decades of “decadence and decline” but said its punishing economic crisis would intensify over the coming months, as a “who’s who” of the global far right assembled in Buenos Aires to celebrate the radical libertarian’s inauguration. Addressing tens of thousands of supporters outside Argentina’s turquoise-domed neoclassical congress, Milei – a mercurial". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Javier Milei sworn in as president in ‘tipping point’ for Argentina Argentina’s new president, Javier Milei, has vowed to lead his country out of decades of “decadence and decline” but said its punishing economic crisis would intensify over the coming months, as a “who’s who” of the global far right assembled in Buenos Aires to celebrate the radical libertarian’s inauguration. Addressing tens of thousands of supporters outside Argentina’s turquoise-domed neoclassical congress, Milei – a mercurial
